channel.title: Need help with using an array for a timer
channel.description:
Alright what I'm trying to do is create a timer for respawning objects. I need this for my woodcutting skill. After you cut down any tree it is replaced by a stump and a timer should start counting a certain amount of time before the tree respawns. I can't use one timer for every tree because the timer would keep changing and it would be all messed up. I could make more timers which would be a waste of space and would take me forever. I thought it would be easier to use an array. It would be easier if I could actually get it to work. My problem is making an if statement that checks for the next array that isn't in use. Here's what I have so far:
[code]public int[] respawntimer = new int[100]; //Declaring the integer as an array ReplaceObject2(objectX,objectY,6951,-1,10);//Remove object completely(example) if(respawntimer[0] != 0) { int i = 0; i++; respawntimer[i] = 60;[/code] This doesn't actually do much but it's all I have so far. It only checks the 0 array though and if it's in use it adds to the array and the next array is now in use. Instead of checking if 0 is in use or not I'm trying to check if any of the arrays are in use or not and than I want it to use the next array that is 0 or is null.
Thanks for reading and hopefully you can help me. ;)
